abstract.p: Cordiant Communications Group, London, is acquiring PSD Associates, London, brand consultancy and design agency with 70 employees; WPP.com, London, is taking minority stake in five Internet-related agencies and companies for total cash investment of $16 million (Advertising column) (S)

block.p: Two large agencies are acquiring or taking equity stakes in other concerns.
The Cordiant Communications Group in London is acquiring PSD Associates in London, a brand consultancy and design agency with 70 employees who work for clients like Swatch.
Two large agencies are acquiring or taking equity stakes in other concerns.
The Cordiant Communications Group in London is acquiring PSD Associates in London, a brand consultancy and design agency with 70 employees who work for clients like Swatch.

Cordiant said it would initially issue 4.88 million new shares -- worth about $22 million -- for the acquisition. The total payment in new Cordiant shares could rise to as much as $52.8 million if profit-based performance targets are met through the end of 2003, Cordiant said.

And WPP.com in London and New York, part of the WPP Group that includes interactive agencies, companies and services, is taking a minority stake in five Internet-related agencies and companies, for a total cash investment of $16 million.

They are: Big Words in San Francisco, a Web site geared to college students; Imagine in Rehovot, Israel, which offers electronic customer-relationship management software; Metapack in London, which builds, designs and manages online logistics services; Red Sheriff in Sydney, an Internet-based measurement and market research company; and Spydre Labs in Miami, an online venture capital and incubator company. WPP is taking a stake of about 25 percent in Spydre and less than 20 percent in the other companies.
